content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-024-05-A |Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy. |Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy. |Rank=A |Title=Know the definition of post partum haemorrhage (PPH) |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=5}} This is a '''haemorrhage >500 mL'' in the 24 hours following childbirth, whether natural or by caesarean section. This haemorrhage is '''severe''' above '''1000mL'''.'''(Cf. [[Abnormal genital bleeding in post-parfum SD-110|110. Abnormal genital bleeding in the post partum]])'''

properties.question: What is the definition of postpartum haemorrhage (PPH)?
properties.option_a: Bleeding of less than 500 mL within 24 hours after childbirth.
properties.option_b: Bleeding of 500-1000 mL within 24 hours after childbirth.
properties.option_c: Bleeding of more than 1000 mL within 24 hours after childbirth.
properties.option_d: Bleeding of any amount within 48 hours after childbirth.
